decks.notes: The main idea of this Dimir Control deck is to use a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By making efficient use of powerful cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Ancestral Recall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage through spells like Ponder and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds additional value and flexibility to the deck, allowing for recurring threats and resources.

The deck focuses on assembling the Phyrexian Dreadnought combo as quickly as possible while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells and disruptive cards like Dress Down. The deck aims to control the game by using permission spells and removal to protect the combo pieces and create a window of opportunity to win the game. The mana base is streamlined to support the combo and ensure consistency in casting spells. The deck is designed to be efficient, proactive, and able to present a quick clock to overwhelm the opponent.

The focus of this deck is to quickly disrupt your opponent's resources while deploying aggressive threats to close out the game swiftly. By utilizing cards like Wasteland, Sphere of Resistance, Thorn of Amethyst, and Trinisphere, you can slow down your opponent's game plan while ramping up your own with Mishra's Workshop and Ancient Tomb. The key win conditions in this deck are Golos, Tireless Pilgrim, Patchwork Automaton, and Scrawling Crawler, which can overwhelm your opponent with their abilities and power. Overall, this deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

The main concept of this deck is to create a disruptive and aggressive strategy by utilizing artifacts to slow down opponents while deploying powerful threats quickly. By generating mana through Mishra's Workshop and other sources, the deck can play high-impact cards like Golos, Tireless Pilgrim and Lodestone Golem while also utilizing cards like Sphere of Resistance and Chalice of the Void to hinder opponents. With a mix of artifact creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its efficient and resilient game plan.

This deck is focused on assembling and utilizing the powerful combo of Paradoxical Outcome. By generating significant card advantage and mana through spells like Ancestral Recall, Black Lotus, and Manifold Key, the deck aims to quickly draw through the deck and generate a game-winning advantage. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect its combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies. With access to powerful cards like Tinker, Yawgmoth's Will, and Karn, the Great Creator, the deck is able to create explosive turns and overwhelm opponents with its combo potential.

The deck focuses on assembling a powerful storm combo by casting multiple spells in a single turn to generate a large amount of mana and draw cards. Key cards like Bolas's Citadel, Tendrils of Agony, and Ancestral Recall help to facilitate this strategy. The deck also utilizes cards like Time Vault and Karn, the Great Creator to further enhance its storm capabilities. By efficiently chaining spells together and utilizing powerful mana acceleration, the deck can overwhelm opponents and secure victory in a short amount of time.
